date_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2022
comment: I recently needed elegant glasses for an anniversary dinner and I'm really glad that I chose these sophisticated champagne glasses.Despite the fact that the glasses were inexpensive, they look really classy. The packaging was gorgeous and the glasses themselves look really well-made. I liked that they were thin but not too fragile and had a comfortable weight to them that wasn't too heavy. They were also really stable and didn't fall over easily. The tapered glasses allowed us to maintain a comfortable grip and choose whether we wanted to hold it at a wider part of the glass or a narrower one.The glasses are big enough to hold a lot of liquid. One of the reasons I chose these glasses was that the description said the tapered shape prevented drinks from losing their carbonation too quickly and I was very happy to see that that was indeed the case. I even compared it one of my older glasses with a wider shape and the difference was very noticeable. Another one of my favorite features of this set is that they are dishwasher safe, which makes cleanup easy and efficient.All in all, these glasses are exactly what I was looking for and I'm very happy with my choice. I look forward to using these more frequently because they seem to hold up really well and will definitely buy another set if I ever need more.

Always a good thing though I was expecting lead to have been already forbidden in any utensils coming in contact with our mouths. overview_text: Thank goodness for good delivery people!
comment: For the cost of only $3 per glass this was a great find! They are real glass and arrived with no issues. They are good sized for having with a meal, and the design is very nice, simple but contemporary. We love the clarity of the glass and the square base of these. I was not totally convinced these would arrive intact and we considered the purchase a gamble on the outcome.I can't believe we got these for $3 each ($12.99 for the set of 4) overnight, free delivery. They say they are made in USA and were advt as lead-free. Sure hope they really are. We love these glasses and what a deal!The glasses were in a lightweight cardboard box with open peek style sides as one you would find a four set of glasses in any store. Thank you lucky stars for such a good mail delivery lady!!!! These glasses were delivered with care all the way and placed gently on the porch, thank goodness! For those who don't have careful mail people.... just be glad these glasses can be returned if they arrive damaged. Feeling very glad we ordered these on a day that we ordered no other items to go in the box with the glasses! That said, I want to reiterate, the glasses are fab! :-)

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
comment: I recently purchased a set of plastic wine glasses from Amazon and I must say, I am extremely impressed with their quality and design. As someone who loves to entertain guests and enjoy a glass of wine in the evening, I was looking for a set of durable, reusable glasses that wouldn't shatter if accidentally dropped. These plastic wine glasses fit the bill perfectly!Firstly, I was pleasantly surprised by how elegant and stylish they look. The clear plastic material has a high-quality, crystal-like appearance that adds a touch of sophistication to any table setting. The shape of the glass is also very flattering, with a tall stem and a wide bowl that allows the wine to breathe and fully express its flavors.But the true test came when I actually used them for the first time. I was amazed at how sturdy and stable they felt in my hand, despite being made of plastic. They didn't wobble or tip over easily, and I felt confident using them for both red and white wines. The material also seems to insulate the wine, keeping it at the perfect temperature for longer.Cleaning them was a breeze too! I simply rinsed them with warm water and soap, and they came out looking just as shiny and new as when I first opened the package. I've used them several times now and they still look and feel as good as new.Overall, I highly recommend these plastic wine glasses to anyone looking for a durable, stylish and convenient alternative to traditional glassware. They're perfect for outdoor gatherings, picnics, or even for daily use in your home. I'm extremely happy with my purchase and will definitely be buying more in the future!

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
overview_text: I love a good coupe- delicate but beautiful!
comment: Champagne flutes are so boring. These coupes bring back the classic feel for a good champagne toast, esp. if you are drinking a good one. Sized generously so you can enjoy the aroma and deliciousness even before your first sip. Obviously your champagne will lose its carbonation sooner in a coupe vs. a flute but girl, you should be drinking it, not photographing that!!And there is nothing more stunning than a champagne coupe tower at a wedding or special celebration. These are a little delicate but I think they'll hold up just fine with handwashing and care.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
comment: I had been looking for coupe glasses locally for some time without success. At the current price of $5 per glass, these are very affordable for the quality.These glasses are the perfect cross between being fragile and dainty, yet still comfortable enough to use in an outdoor setting. These glasses are lightweight and certainly not designed for being banged down on counters or bumped. However, they are not so thin that I worry about chipping them by setting them down on a stone table or toasting. One thing that I will mention, is that these are dishwasher safe, but I would use caution when dishwashing them. Because they are so light, they are prone to moving around in the water spray and could easily break. I always hand wash mine and have found them to be very easy to clean. If you have a gentle dishwasher, this may be no issue, but I would probably still suggest putting them only on the top rack.Overall, these glasses look phenomenal and I would recommend them to anyone. They are perfect for everything from a Manhattan to a martini and a mojito. These add a touch of class to any gathering and the price is right.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
comment: I love these old-school glasses. They're much more like older (1920s) champagne glasses than margarita or daiquiri glasses, IMO (they don't hold much), but they're gorgeous and excellent for champagne cocktails, lemon twists, etc. I don't do alcohol, but I feel very fancy drinking sparkling cider out of them, and my husband likes them for prosecco. I love to make a special cocktail for guests, so I can't wait to be able to have people over again and serve something fun in these retro glasses. They are pretty sturdy...my dog pulled the box off of the foyer table and onto the floor before I had a chance to open it (he thinks all packages are Bark Boxes üòÅ), and there was no cushioning in the box, so I expected them to be broken or at least chipped, but they were still flawless. They're not the highest quality crystal, but they look and feel good, and I'll take sturdy for 98% of applications when it comes to glassware.I would definitely recommend these, and I plan to order at least one more set.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022
overview_text: Low quality, lack of quality control, actually made by Crisa
comment: Edit/update: so I've had these for a while now, and I have to admit that despite their defects, they're kindof growing on me. I still like their design, and the thickness of the glasses is good. I just wish their quality was better. Libbey did send me free replacements which was nice, but the replacements still had problems. They were better than the original ones I had overall, but not by like a ton. They still had some problems. Despite that, I have to admit that having had them for a while, I kinda like them despite their imperfections. I just wish so much that they were higher quality because I love the design. It's a real shame. Libbey has this one major flaw which is some kind of problem with quality, either with quality control or manufacturing, I'm not sure. Their designs are great, but the quality on them is just not great.Despite that, I'm finding that I do like these glasses.So, if you can live with lots of small imperfections, I think these are actually great glasses. You just have to live with imperfections, which sucks, but oh well. Libbey's customer service is good, but I honestly would have prefered if they'd just fixed their problem with quality and manufacturing rather than sending me free glasses. The free glasses were nice, but I just wish they would get their act together on quality because their products are actually great. Anyway, I like these glasses despite their flaws, and I think you'll find much the same experience if you can stand the small imperfections.Original review:I bought these because I was expected high quality glasses. I had read the other reviews, and was mostly concerned about broken glasses. What I should have been more concerned about was the reports of low quality. Just one of these problems in and of itself wouldn't be so bad, but there are a lot of problems that affect almost every glass:Every single glass has a tilted base/bottom inside the glass. The tilts are all different, some aren't so bad, a few are very noticeable. One of the short glasses doesn't even have a flat base at the very bottom of the glass. One of the tall glasses leans to one side, like it's slouching. All of the glasses have small bubbles and other imperfections on them. The tall glasses all have noticeable seams running down their sides, some of the short glasses do as well. Some of the glasses have small dents and other impressions. The tops of the glasses are not very level, though this is fairly minor. One of the glasses has a black spot in the glass on the outside, no clue what it is or why it's there, seems to be part of the glass or something. Every glass has a scar-like seam at the bottom, looks like a cut that's been stitched. There are lots of points where it looks like the glass has been slightly pinched or something during manufacture.I dishwashed all of these glasses, mind you. They seem sturdy, and if it weren't for these imperfections, this would be a fine glass set. But there are just so many imperfections. The lack of a flat base inside the glass makes every glass just look off. They just look kinda poorly made.I'm dubious about returning them. If I exchange them for more of the same, I'm afraid I'll just end up with the same problems. If I buy other glasses, who is to say if they'll be any better? I was hoping that by buying Libbey, I'd be buying some high quality glasses, but that isn't the case.These don't even have the Libbey L on the bottom. They say Crisa on the bottom because apparently Libbey owns Crisa. So although these claim to be Libbey glasses, they're actually Crisa glasses manufactured by Crisa which Libbey owns. I originally also ordered some heavy base glasses from Libbey, but cancelled those after looking at the low quality of these.If you're looking for cheap glasses and don't really care what they look like, then I guess these will do. But if you're looking for high quality glasses, buy something else. These are low quality.

overview_text: Basic and inexpensive high and lowball glasses
comment: These clean and clear tumblers come with no frills and no promises.  They may be thinner than some other brands, but then, they are amongst the lowest priced sets offered on Amazon.  So while some reviews are crabby about "easily broken" the product is indeed made of glass and will succumb to intentional or unintentional trauma.  I like the simple yet elegant look of these glasses and appreciate the balance of the heavier bottom.  They are a good value, arrived well packaged to protect from breakage during shipment, and are a good choice for everyday drinking glasses.  I do not recommend using them for any other purpose than to hold a delicious beverage and please, take appropriate care when handling any glass item.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
comment: I just received my Libbey package in the mail from Libbey: Libbey Blue Ribbon Goblet Beverage Glasses, 12.8-ounce, Set of 8. I am mostly pleased and happy with the glasses, but not 100%.(1) I am extremely happy with the timing. The glasses were originally supposed to get to me on March 4th, but they arrived on March 2nd.(2) I am extremely happy with the packaging of the 8 goblets. I was actually very worried that they'd be packaged in a flimsy box. I am very happy that I was incorrect in that they were packaged very securely. The only way these would have been damaged is if someone dropped them.(3) I am mediocre happy because I had expected them to be slightly larger in the opening. The opening is definitely not 3.1 inches. They are quaint though and very pretty.(4) I am most definitely NOT happy with the Quality Assurance team. One of the glasses base is uneven. As you set the glass down, it wobbles from side to side. This is a workmanship/manufacture/glasscreation process error and an issue that the Libbey QA team should have caught. Turning the glass over, bottoms up, the surface looks like a twisted frisbee.(5) I am EXTREMELY happy with Libbey's Customer Care team. I contacted LIbbey (the package comes with information on how to contact Libbey if you are unsatisfied with their product and information on how to care for the glasses) and they were able to quickly rectify the issue with with wobbly glass.With the experience of this purchase, I would definitely order from Libbey again. =)

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
comment: I was looking to replace nice heavy weight commercial style glasses (Libbey Inverness, 14 oz) with something of a similar weight and heft.  These glasses are attractive and do have a weighted bottom, but the thickness of the walls of the glass were not comparable.  The weight (not capacity) of my old beverage glasses is 18.52 oz each, these glasses weigh 11.85 oz each (there is also a 6 oz capacity difference, these being an 8 oz capacity).  I would think for most users these glasses would be very acceptable, and they are quite attractive, but having been in the foodservice industry for several decades, I wanted something with much heavier weight (and assumed durability) than these seem to offer.  I will most likely return these and try the Libby Optiva 14 oz which look to be a heavier weight.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
comment: Recently, I started harvesting wild prickly pear cactus fruit, and making prickly pear margaritas for my wife and me.  We didn't have proper glasses though, until I spotted these.  I mean, all margaritas have that southwest feel, but a glass that looks like a saguaro cactus and has a cactus-based drink, how can you beat that?  They look great and my wife enjoys the drinks even more.  Exceeds my expectations for fun and enjoyment.  See below.Most people start out reviews from one of two positions.  About 5% of all reviews are a one star because the product they received was poor quality, or they did not get it all and the consumer is just mad.  I don‚Äôt believe 5% of every product made goes out useless, but everyone who gets a bad unit will tell you.About 90% of reviewers start at 5 stars, and if the reviewer did not find anything heinous about the product, that‚Äôs what they give.  To 90% of people, 5 stars means, ‚Äúit was just ok.‚ÄùFrom this day forward, my reviews start from the middle.  Three stars: the product met my expectations.  If I give it four stars, the product exceeded my expectations for quality, value, or performance. In case of five stars, the got itself out of the box itself and walked across the water.If I give a product two stars, it failed to meet my expectations in some way.  Anything deserving the ignominious one star review either went back to the vendor or in the dumpster.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
comment: I giggled out loud when I opened the box. It‚Äôs on me, I should‚Äôve paid attention to the dimensions, but I just never dreamed margarita glasses would be so short & tiny! So, these diminutive, 4-inch (only 4-inch!) glasses were quite a surprise, & actually, an adorable & amusing sight! The only bummer: I need way bigger margarita glasses than this! These don‚Äôt hold much liquid at all in the first place, & if you add ice, it‚Äôll be that much less. So unfortunately, they‚Äôre not completely practical for me; that said, however, I still might keep them! Why? Because 1) they have a beautiful, modern design, 2) they are a pleasure to hold, as the small, smooth base fits nicely in your hand, & 3) their small size really does make them adorable, & I think they‚Äôd charm everyone & give them a chuckle. So, I do still recommend them, as long as you are aware of the dimensions & are okay with very small margarita glasses. Maybe you would put a whole pitcher on the table, & then just keep refilling the glasses? I hope the manufacturer will eventually make & offer a larger size in this same design, though, as I do love every single thing about them except for their size.

Otherwise I recommend getting plastic or acrylic.Also it‚Äôs glass it‚Äôs not 100 percent perfect. comment: These cups successfully make my drinks colder. It can bring a full 16oz of room temperature soda to refrigerator temperatures in just a few minutes. It can bring a second filling down to very close to refrigerator temperature, too, if you're fast enough.The one actual problem I have is that the inside of the cups are so narrow that there is absolutely no way to clean them without a bottle brush. So make sure you have one, or just go ahead and order one at the same time.I do have a few nitpicks: It feels to me that there's too little freezing gel in these cups. As I said, it successfully makes my drinks cold, so I don't know what I'm complaining about, but it's seriously only like 60% full. It seems like they'd work even better if they were more full. The instructions say to freeze them upside down, but that's not really feasible in my freezer for space reasons. But freezing them on their side doesn't seem to cause any problems. They sometimes make cracking noises, like ice cracking. But I never see any cracks form in the frozen gel. I'm worried that it's cracking the plastic shell. (They seem to do this no matter the orientation they were frozen in.)

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
comment: This tumbler works ok.  However, at room temperature the wall cavity is only 1/3 full of gel, up to the lower edge of the silicone band. See the photo of a dry, empty cup. Just out of the freezer, it‚Äôs up to the higher edge of the band. So, it doesn‚Äôt chill the top third and it has the the unusual appearance of gel droplets that don‚Äôt go away.  Maybe the manufacturers don‚Äôt fill it with more gel to account for more expansion in the case someone puts it in a super cold freezer.  Maybe it would be a hazard to have frozen gel at the rim, where it touches your lips, but the frozen gel level stops well short of that in regular usage. Whatever the reason, the gel droplets are not aesthetic, but the bottom half does help keep the contents cold and the silicone does not get wet or slippery in your hand.

A 12 oz pour generates enough of a head to fill to the top with most beers. I store mine upright in the freezer so they are always ready for use. I haven't tried freezing them upside down yet, but plan to do so to see how that works. The black band is supposed to make them more comfortable to hold, and it does tend to insulate a little so you don't numb your hand so much.  That being said, I don't find them to be as comfortable to hold as the set of double wall glass beer glasses I also use. I think the difference is the size and texture of the grip area.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2021
overview_text: I wish we could give half or partial 'stars'
comment: I rated these a 4, but for me they are really more like 3.5-3.75.Nothing wrong per se it just comes down to wishing there was a little more freezer gel in the cups.The first one I put in the freezer, I did upside down so debris didnt get IN the cup while it was there, not thinking of the gel note being able to expand when frozen.  Therefore the full bottom 2-3inches of the cup had no frozen gel, and therefore no cooling in what I will assume is the most important place... the bottom of the cup where the oldest beer will be sitting just warming up. :(The second try I froze the cup right side up.  This worked better because now the bottom of the cup had a thick cold frozen gel in it... however, that left the cooling capability at the top of the cup lacking.  The amount of gel in these cups when frozen stops somewhere under the silicon band.  Leaving maybe 3inches at the top of the cup empty of frozen cooling gel.Therefore the frozen gel is only directly cooling maybe 7-9 ounces of your 12oz beer. Maybe not a horrible issue since its the top, and those 3-5 ounces will be the first consumed and therefore the top beer level will drop into the cooling zone sooner than later, but its not ideal.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2016
overview_text: Tips to keep your glasses from breaking (hopefully).
comment: I gotta say that if these don't break, I love them. I've found that I can pour 3-4 cold beers into one glass over the period of a few hours, and it stays very cool. The gray "rubber band" keeps my fingers comfortable on what would be a VERY cold glass. I would have given them 5 Stars except for a few things.  First off, they are NOT pint glasses. The outside is about the same size as a standard "glass" pint-glass, but because of the insulating gel and double-walled construction, the actual capacity is just over 12 ounces. This is not a huge deal as most bottles and cans are 12 oz, but it's worth mentioning.The other reasons for knocking off a star have to do with "special handling" that I do to prevent them from breaking.1) I would avoid using them to cool down a warm beer. Putting something warm into something that is very cold causes expansion stresses in the glass, which can cause it to split apart at the seam. I know, the product description says you can use it this way, but if you want them to last a long time, keep your beer in the fridge, then pour it in the glass. It will stay ice-cold for a looonng time!2) I shouldn't have to tell you to hand-wash these, as that's what the box says, but I've noticed in the "Questions" section that some people said they can go in the dishwasher. NO. The weld that seals the gel inside is the weakest part of the glass, so it shouldn't be subjected to sudden or extreme changes in temperature. Here's what I do to clean them. Leave them on the kitchen counter until the gel isn't frozen anymore- at LEAST a few hours. Wash them in lukewarm (roughly room-temperature) water. Leave them on a drying rack to dry COMPLETELY before refreezing.3) Put them in the freezer standing upright. Do NOT lay them on their sides or put them upside down. As the gel freezes and expands, this gives it room to expand up towards the seam. (The gel stops expanding just below the seam.)  If the gel is already at the seam when it starts to freeze, it puts added stress on the seam.This is a minimal amount of additional "work" to keep the glasses working for a long time, but I'm disappointed that I should have to do it at all. These glasses were a great idea that was poorly executed, and with bad usage suggestions in the description.

The shorter glasses are great for iced coffee and juice.I washed the glasses in the top rack of my dishwasher and they came out perfectly. date_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
overview_text: Sturdy glassware, fairly thick and with a heavy base
comment: These are good-looking glasses. They're sturdy with a heavy base and heavy.There are a total of 8 of each size, the 20 ounce highball and the 10 ounce tumbler.I like the slightly smoky tint to the glass that isn't too dark or colorful to be tacky.The only thing I will nit-pick is that I received a small tumbler with noticeable "dings" in the glass -- as if they'd been dropped on sharp gravel -- they didn't brake, but just left little gouges in a single tumbler, almost as if it either failed quality control or was a factory second. (see photos). It's not likely it occurred in shipping because everything was packed very well, with little chance to cause that kind of pits in the glassIt's not a game-changer, but I like for brand new items to be new and unblemished with scratches or nicks. I deducted a star for that.As it is, we can't use the chipped up tumbler because there's a good chance the defects could cut someone if they held the glass right where the chipped areas were. They don't seem to affect the integrity of the glass, but it's not worth the risk.Overall, it's a nice set of glassware to replace your outdated stuff or for a new set of decent glasses.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022
overview_text: Low quality, lack of quality control, actually made by Crisa
comment: Edit/update: so I've had these for a while now, and I have to admit that despite their defects, they're kindof growing on me. I still like their design, and the thickness of the glasses is good. I just wish their quality was better. Libbey did send me free replacements which was nice, but the replacements still had problems. They were better than the original ones I had overall, but not by like a ton. They still had some problems. Despite that, I have to admit that having had them for a while, I kinda like them despite their imperfections. I just wish so much that they were higher quality because I love the design. It's a real shame. Libbey has this one major flaw which is some kind of problem with quality, either with quality control or manufacturing, I'm not sure. Their designs are great, but the quality on them is just not great.Despite that, I'm finding that I do like these glasses.So, if you can live with lots of small imperfections, I think these are actually great glasses. You just have to live with imperfections, which sucks, but oh well. Libbey's customer service is good, but I honestly would have prefered if they'd just fixed their problem with quality and manufacturing rather than sending me free glasses. The free glasses were nice, but I just wish they would get their act together on quality because their products are actually great. Anyway, I like these glasses despite their flaws, and I think you'll find much the same experience if you can stand the small imperfections.Original review:I bought these because I was expected high quality glasses. I had read the other reviews, and was mostly concerned about broken glasses. What I should have been more concerned about was the reports of low quality. Just one of these problems in and of itself wouldn't be so bad, but there are a lot of problems that affect almost every glass:Every single glass has a tilted base/bottom inside the glass. The tilts are all different, some aren't so bad, a few are very noticeable. One of the short glasses doesn't even have a flat base at the very bottom of the glass. One of the tall glasses leans to one side, like it's slouching. All of the glasses have small bubbles and other imperfections on them. The tall glasses all have noticeable seams running down their sides, some of the short glasses do as well. Some of the glasses have small dents and other impressions. The tops of the glasses are not very level, though this is fairly minor. One of the glasses has a black spot in the glass on the outside, no clue what it is or why it's there, seems to be part of the glass or something. Every glass has a scar-like seam at the bottom, looks like a cut that's been stitched. There are lots of points where it looks like the glass has been slightly pinched or something during manufacture.I dishwashed all of these glasses, mind you. They seem sturdy, and if it weren't for these imperfections, this would be a fine glass set. But there are just so many imperfections. The lack of a flat base inside the glass makes every glass just look off. They just look kinda poorly made.I'm dubious about returning them. If I exchange them for more of the same, I'm afraid I'll just end up with the same problems. If I buy other glasses, who is to say if they'll be any better? I was hoping that by buying Libbey, I'd be buying some high quality glasses, but that isn't the case.These don't even have the Libbey L on the bottom. They say Crisa on the bottom because apparently Libbey owns Crisa. So although these claim to be Libbey glasses, they're actually Crisa glasses manufactured by Crisa which Libbey owns. I originally also ordered some heavy base glasses from Libbey, but cancelled those after looking at the low quality of these.If you're looking for cheap glasses and don't really care what they look like, then I guess these will do. But if you're looking for high quality glasses, buy something else. These are low quality.

We got the clear ones, as we'll be putting them in our home bar we're creating, and we're not quite sure if our glassware will have a color scheme yet, so you can't go wrong with clear! I'm perplexed why they are not dishwasher safe, and why the Kate Aspen website says to not put hot drinks in them (cold drinks only). They seem sturdy enough so I'm not sure if they would crack from heat? Or if there is a chemical in the glass that makes it unsafe to expose to heat? I posted this question on the Kate Aspen website to ask, and I'll update my review if they answer. For now, I'm taking one star off for the inability to put a hot drink in them.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
overview_text: Nice set to give you options- Im happy!!
comment: I needed a set of cocktail drinking glasses for our place in Tacoma- not a set that would see a lot of use but, be ready when we were!! Of course, when we do get the time to sneak away- it‚Äôs always for some adulting time.. So, I decided to stock the glass cupboard with a few solid drink glasses.. whisky short, wine stems, beer mugs.. Only, we were missing the ability to serve cosmos or margaritas in anything but, a red solo- (I know, tragic!) Although, a coupe isn‚Äôt usually used for Margarita fish bowls.. these could double as both!! I‚Äôm loving that.With a set of four, it‚Äôs perfect to finish off The different variations in our cupboard.. and it should be noted bc, these run a tad bigger then a regular coupe- they can make a pretty solid Margarita glass if we so desire! This was an added bonus I found after arrival.. yay!These glasses appear to be of clear blown glass- not foggy or, scuffed. They have a thinner rim which, I prefer for drinking from...  BUT, feel it will be necessary to use extra care not to chip to top edges. In fact, I had to put a foam liner on the shelf so when putting away and storing.. I don‚Äôt accidentally bump and chip the edges...However, on the flipside the base feels wide/weighted enough to be sturdy and not feel tipsy.. very ergonomically correct.I recommend for anyone wanting a solid cocktail glass set without having to invest high $ to get one- for the price point, and the option for Use with multiple drinks.. this is a solid find. Note: this can also be used for a dessert parfait or even a fruit cup as well!  Anyone looking for a set to give options- this is a good one! I hope this info can help your decision.. Feel free to let me know!

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021
comment: Nicely shaped champagne coupes. Good clarity. 7oz to the brim but comfortably holds 5oz. This is a nice alternative for a conical martini glasses or Nick and Nora glasses. For serving champagne a perfectly acceptable alternative to flutes. They are a bit delicate, so hand washing is a must. Knocking one over on the table is enough to break it so it‚Äôs not the most sturdy.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021
comment: I like using coupes for my non-Martini cocktails, like Manhattans.  Since these are quite a bit larger than my other Coupes, and I don't have any Margarita glasses I love, I've taken to using them for Margaritas.  For that reason, I am giving them four stars, but I am tempted to give it three.These hold about 6 to 7 ounces instead of the 5.5 to 6 ounces that my others hold.  I wouldn't go bigger because these are meant for cremants or classic cocktails versus long drinks, but I already think these are a too big because the rim is just wide enough that they don't fit in the common slots of my dishwasher, which is really annoying, especially because they are a bit too fragile; I broke one almost immediately.I'm not overly crazy about Riedel, but since it's a common brand I'm familiar with, I will make some comparisons:  Riedel tends to be really thin glass, but it's also super clean, clear, and perfect.  Good for fancy, but almost better for special occasions as to not break them on a regular night.  These are Riedel thin, but they show imperfections and they seem to be more fragile, considering I already broke one.Definitely like coupes.  But I like my others better for Manhattans and everyday use.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021
comment: Yes, these are the true coupe, the classic champagne or champagne cocktail glass, revered for decades. More sturdy than delicate. Quite straightforward.Would have preferred a thinner rim for a more elegant sip.Nice retro change of pace from flutes.Cheers!

overview_text: Love this for my coffee.. just one problem with the product pictures
comment: This tumbler cup is really nice for my morning coffee. It keeps it nice and hot and doesn't burn my hands since it's double walled. I've used it for some cold drinks and it seems to keep its cool as well! Since I make coffee drinks, I like to use a the lines for how much of each ingredient I'm putting in. It's really handy! The cup has a good feel to it while holding it and doesn't feel super thin. I haven't experienced the clouding that others have experienced just yet, but I'll definitely update if needed.The only disappointment was not with the cup itself, but with the slightly confusing product pictures. The pictures include a picture with just the black lid and an "accessories" picture listing all color lids and straws. The reason this is confusing is because the black one doesn't specify that it is NOT included with the cup, but the accessory picture does specify that everything in the picture is NOT included. It is NOT OBVIOUS that the cup DOES NOT at least come with a black lid without looking at the reviews and QA section.This product otherwise has been very good to me and I recommend for coffee and tea drinkers!

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
comment: I love red, so when I saw this tumbler, I just had to order it. That, plus the fact that it can be put in a microwave. I haven't tried that yet, because I got this for cold drinks. Not all double-walled brands are the same and, while some do produce condensation, this one doesn't. It also says it's dishwasher-safe, but I'm going to hand wash mine, just to be safe.I do wish it was a bit thinner higher up, because I have small hands, and in order to get a good grip on it, I have to hold it more toward the bottom. I have a holder in which it fits, but don't like to use it all the time. Also be aware that, like most double-walled glasses, this doesn't comfortably hold a full 24oz. I'm OK with that, because I just needed 20oz, and it handles that amount well. Further, like most plastic items, the lip isn't smooth, and it feels a little rough on the mouth. It isn't horrible, but I do wish they would find a way to fix that. For these reasons, I docked it a star.Other than that, I really like this tumbler, and have already ordered th 16 oz version to use for coffee.

It‚Äôs cardboard powder and it came off with a rise.The base is thick and sturdy, while it does thin out a lot towards the top, so if you don‚Äôt like thin glass this isn‚Äôt for you.These are gentle glasses, but in my opinion all glass should be cared for gently. Otherwise I recommend getting plastic or acrylic.Also it‚Äôs glass it‚Äôs not 100 percent perfect. It will be as close as possible to perfect, but there are chances it will have slight bubbles, bumps, and even be a tiny bit taller or shorter.These specific glasses I received are all practically identical.We will see how they handle in a dish washer although I‚Äôm more of a wash by hand person.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2016
comment: I searched long and hard for a simple juice glass and found almost exactly what I was looking for in these Libbey glasses. It is amazing how many unattractive or impractical juice glasses are on the market, and how hard it is to find glasses that are plain clear glass and cylindrical in shape. The solid heavy base makes these glasses stable.  There is a slight ripple in the middle of each glass that is not apparent in the photograph online and is not mentioned in the description.  I thought it was a defect when I unwrapped the first glass, but decided it is an intentional design feature, since it is in every glass.  Although surprising, it is not objectionable.  My only disappointment is that I was hoping to find a 6 ounce juice glass, but found only these 5 ounce glasses that satisfied all of my other criteria, so I chose to compromise on the size rather than on the style.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2015
comment: Glad to find these glasses,  since I'm down to my last two and couldn't find them in local stores -- they're quite sturdy, but glass and I have this fundamental misunderstanding...They would be a little too small for morning juice, IMO, but at about 3.5 ounces (that's what they actually hold -- 5 oz is right to the brim) they are perfect for serving a cordial or liqueur or dessert sherry over a bit of ice.  I often make little individual desserts for portion control, and these look more elegant than small bowls and take up less space in freezer or fridge. Try a parfait or mini-trifle with a bit of pound cake drizzled with liqueur, a spoonful of fresh fruit, and a dab of ice cream (or whipped cream or soft custard) -- or a small serving of warm apple crisp (or sliced grilled peaches!) with a spoonful of ice cream. Or a small serving of a rich drink like a White Russian.  You feel indulged, and the risk of plowing mindlessly through seconds or thirds (or the whole serving dish) is reduced.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
comment: Recently, I started harvesting wild prickly pear cactus fruit, and making prickly pear margaritas for my wife and me.  We didn't have proper glasses though, until I spotted these.  I mean, all margaritas have that southwest feel, but a glass that looks like a saguaro cactus and has a cactus-based drink, how can you beat that?  They look great and my wife enjoys the drinks even more.  Exceeds my expectations for fun and enjoyment.  See below.Most people start out reviews from one of two positions.  About 5% of all reviews are a one star because the product they received was poor quality, or they did not get it all and the consumer is just mad.  I don‚Äôt believe 5% of every product made goes out useless, but everyone who gets a bad unit will tell you.About 90% of reviewers start at 5 stars, and if the reviewer did not find anything heinous about the product, that‚Äôs what they give.  To 90% of people, 5 stars means, ‚Äúit was just ok.‚ÄùFrom this day forward, my reviews start from the middle.  Three stars: the product met my expectations.  If I give it four stars, the product exceeded my expectations for quality, value, or performance. In case of five stars, the got itself out of the box itself and walked across the water.If I give a product two stars, it failed to meet my expectations in some way.  Anything deserving the ignominious one star review either went back to the vendor or in the dumpster.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
comment: I giggled out loud when I opened the box. It‚Äôs on me, I should‚Äôve paid attention to the dimensions, but I just never dreamed margarita glasses would be so short & tiny! So, these diminutive, 4-inch (only 4-inch!) glasses were quite a surprise, & actually, an adorable & amusing sight! The only bummer: I need way bigger margarita glasses than this! These don‚Äôt hold much liquid at all in the first place, & if you add ice, it‚Äôll be that much less. So unfortunately, they‚Äôre not completely practical for me; that said, however, I still might keep them! Why? Because 1) they have a beautiful, modern design, 2) they are a pleasure to hold, as the small, smooth base fits nicely in your hand, & 3) their small size really does make them adorable, & I think they‚Äôd charm everyone & give them a chuckle. So, I do still recommend them, as long as you are aware of the dimensions & are okay with very small margarita glasses. Maybe you would put a whole pitcher on the table, & then just keep refilling the glasses? I hope the manufacturer will eventually make & offer a larger size in this same design, though, as I do love every single thing about them except for their size.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022
overview_text: Pretty for the price. Durable? Eh...
comment: Purchased these after much reviewing and after our first set of similarly styled glassware from a Bullseye-Themed Competitor, hoping that this would be a step up. The verdict 6 months later: ....meh?They look and feel miles better than the starter set you'd pick up at the store. The bottom is significantly weightier, helping with stability on a surface and when you hold it in your hand. They don't cloud up, even in our old grandpa of a dishwasher. This set is probably intended for more everyday use (which is how we're using it), but it's a classy enough style that you'd feel comfortable serving up a fancy drink or two.That is, of course, if you have a full set remaining by the time your guests arrive. Over the last six months, we've lost a good three of the eight taller glasses due to chipping in the dishwasher and the occasional crack if you tap them against another glass accidentally stacking them in the cupboard. Turns out these are less durable than a toothpick. The shorter glasses have fared better than their older siblings; maybe it's an issue with the strength in the middle of the glass?This is disappointing, especially considering the reputation Libbey has for glassware. I know that it's glassware we're talking about here, not WWE fighters, so I know you have to be a little more careful with them. But alas, I was hoping to get a stronger set this time around. Long story short, if you're going to go with this set, expect to buy your replacement in a year or so. (Or sooner!)

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2022
comment: I have a set of these glasses (Libbey Impressions) that I've had for many years.  Over time, a glass has gotten broken here and there so I ordered an entire new set to add to what I already have.  This new set does not live up to the old version.  The "impressions" (dimples) are more shallow than the original.  Also, the glass feels a little different.  It seems more plastic-like, if that could even be a thing.  The glasses are more lightweight than the originals.  If I didn't have the originals, I probably would like these just fine.  Perhaps the manufacturer has had to cut corners to keep their price down.  I love ordering from Amazon, but sometimes wonder if there's a lot of price pressure on the manufacturers and we consumers end up on the short end.  If given a choice, I would have paid more to be able to have the same quality as the older version.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2022
comment: I was really torn between giving this a 3 or a 4 as it's not quite a 4 but better than a 3 as I try to be fair about my experience with these cups.  In the end I had to err on the side of a 3 after factoring in the price.Pros: Good form, size and grip band.  The gel between the walls freezes in about an hour and does a good job keeping liquids cold with the caveat mentioned below.  Makes for an attractive gift.Cons: Not enough gel between the chambers.  While I understand that there has to be enough room for the gel to expand as it freezes, the manufacturer could easily add half again as much and still have that necessary space allowance.Why is this is a issue?  Because when set upright in the freezer, the gel comes up to just under half the cup's height, which in turn keeps everything at the gel line or below reasonably cold, but anything above it noticeably less so.  If you let it set for a few minutes that difference is even more noticeable.  A better design would be to use vertical silos for the gel so that it would chill the contents from top to bottom, rather than bottom only, or perhaps a lattice of honeycomb shaped cells.Also, don't expect this to keep your beer or other drink cold very long, the gel thaws completely 30-ish mins after setting out in a 80 degree room, and even quicker if exposed to sunlight like at a outdoor grilling.

He said he prefers a frozen mug because he likes the entire glass to be cold and he didn‚Äôt like the shape it froze into. We let it thaw out completely to see if the original round shape would come back but it didn‚Äôt. I have a feeling they will crack easily. They also just came in a brown box. Not very nice for gift giving. If I still had the box I would return them.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2021
comment: I had high hopes for this item. I do not think I would buy it again, but I‚Äôm not going to return it either.  And I certainly would not gift them.  The gel does in fact keep liquids cold for a nice period of time. That‚Äôs pretty great and ultimately the purpose of the item.  But, as you can see in my pictures, the sticky residue from the ‚Äúdo not dishwash‚Äù stickers is pretty bad. I hate when a company puts stickers on and uses adhesive that requires goo-gone to remove the residue. Using that stuff (or anything to remove the gunk) on the plastic will discolor and ruin the item worse.  Also, I presumed that because the item is double wall construction that condensation would not so quickly form on the exterior of the glasses.  Between the frost from being frozen and actual condensation, a substantial wetness does occur on the exterior - even directly on the silicone grip. The outside of the plastic gets super wet when in use.  I won‚Äôt return these, and won‚Äôt buy or gift, and was compelled to write a not so great review.  I don‚Äôt recommend.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2018
overview_text: Elegant but a lot of imperfections
comment: I'm going to come right out and admit that I am EXTREMELY picky when it comes to any serving items because I buy with forever in mind. This is my first new set of glassware in 20 years, and it took me 2 years to find something good enough. I had to go to 2 different BB&B stores to find enough sets that were not flawed, and even then I wound up with one with a wobbly base. It drives me crazy and I will probably just throw that one away. So many glasses had lips that either had tiny hairline cracks, air bubbles, or were not evenly rounded. Some had scratches from moving around in the boxes. A few had uneven bottoms.  Some had the brand name etched in the bottom and some did not. I would have preferred to not look at a name scrawled in my glass, especially one that isn't mine, but I can deal with it.  The tall glasses are very bottom heavy, so I have to be careful when putting them in the dishwasher. They tip easily. I also have the shorter double old fashion glasses. The shorter ones still have the heavy base but don't tip in the washer. The shorter ones had all of the defects that the taller ones had, plus they are so fat that only a few can fit in my standard size kitchen cabinet. These are not suitable for stacking due to the heavy bases and thin lips.If I didn't have to deal with all of the imperfections, I would have given these 5 stars. They are simple yet elegant and I get a lot of compliments on them. In hindsight, I would have just stuck to one size since the double old fashions hold nearly as much as the beverage glasses, but I would probably stick to the taller ones. I think they look better with dinnerware and they are easier to hold. The shorter glasses are so wide and heavy that people with smaller hands have a hard time getting a good grip. They are especially cumbersome for someone with arthritic hands (like me).  All things considered, I would buy these again. however, these are not something that I would order online and hope for the best. I would definitely buy these in person. I'm willing to bet that the people who complained of these glasses breaking easily probably had defective ones. So far, none of mine have broken, even after tipping over in the dish washer.  I am also aware that some of these are not 20 oz as advertised. I don't think mine are, but it doesn't bother me enough to get out the postal scale and measure the weight of water to be sure.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2014
overview_text: Beautiful But Short Lived if Involved With Alcohol
comment: These lovely glasses should be saved for the most sober occasions as they are delicate and quite fragile.  For everyday drink ware, especially involving any alcoholic beverage, they are out of the question.  After a few of my popular Tequila Nuclear Options during our neighborhood game night, it quickly became obvious these were not going to make it beyond the last round of Twister.  These shatter if turned over on a cocktail table or even dropped a short distance on our very plush carpet.  The next morning at least one was broken and another cracked when they simply bumped against one another in the kitchen sink.  The durability of these glasses is quite disappointing indeed!  However, I still award three stars for their beauty, price when on sale, and the several compliments I received on them from guests in the early evening before our last Twister challenge was canceled due to the danger to bare feet.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2013

Immediately I loved them.  They are beautiful, heavy, and clean very easily by hand (no dishwasher :-/).  The only downside is that after 1 year out of the 8 we had received I believe we only have 4 left.  Now I'm not super suave and have my clumsy moments but it does seem as though these glasses are fairly fragile, as glasses can be.  I am however used to sturdier glasses.  So use a bit more care with these, definitely not for child use.  Since I have 4 left I will definitely be ordering some more!UPDATE:  It's been nearly 5 years now with these glasses, and after 12 (possibly 16!)  glasses we now have 4.  They somehow keep breaking, even now in the dishwasher.  I expected these glasses to be of a longer lasting quality.  I have deducted 2 stars and will be purchasing other glasses.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2016
overview_text: Are you buying Slovakian crystal or Chinese glass?
comment: Be extremely careful with which glasses you are purchasing. The entire Mikasa Cheers line of glasses, appears to come in 2 varieties: some are made of crystal and produced in Slovakia and then there is a version made out of plain glass, produced in China. They are marketed intercheangeably, with similar packaging and very discreet mentions of the material and countries of origin, but they are vastly different.I only realized the difference when I bought an additional set of glasses and realized they were made in China and were plain glass as opposed to crystal. They felt completely different in my hands. Of course I returned the Chinese set. If I want cheap Chinese glass I'll just buy a supermarket brand for $10/ set. Very disappointed with the deceptive marketing.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2016
overview_text: Nice Disposable Wine tumblers with a couple of caveats
comment: These are attractive stemless wine/beverage "glasses" and the fact that they are stackable is good for storage.  However, a couple of caveats about this product.  One, I thought these would be a bit thicker, stronger plastic and although the plastic is stronger than those cheap disposable ones you have to attach to the stem base, or those cheap bulk plastic drinking glasses for soft drinks, it's not quite what we expected.  It's easy to wash the glass by hand for reuse, but beware - don't put it in the dishwasher.  I suppose that's a given considering it's plastic, but I tried one glass out of curiosity and it became distorted and is unusable.  Ironically, the heat from the dishwasher made it a stronger plastic - not pliable at all and actually thicker - basically that is what I thought we would be getting.  Anyway, perhaps the outside of the box they come in should say "not dishwasher safe" or "don't put in dishwasher".  At more than a dollar a glass it is not a cheap throw-away, for sure.  But, I don't have to worry about using our regular glass stemmed wine glasses for the large group we'll be entertaining.  No cleaning up, no breakage to worry about.  I wouldn't use these for a sit-down dinner though or a small group of people.  Pleased that they are recyclable.

Unfortunately the tops are great, but the bases look like any other cheap, disposable blowmolded cup. These are usable wine glasses, but clearly are not designed for reuse or any elegance. If you want to have a nice dinner and use plastic wine glasses, I'd recommend something nicer. If you have a casual party and want to have something cheap and unbreakable to toss rather than reuse, these will do that well. To me, they're kind of expensive disposables, and with just a little nicer bottom, would really look impressive. .

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022
overview_text: Pretty for the price. Durable? Eh...
comment: Purchased these after much reviewing and after our first set of similarly styled glassware from a Bullseye-Themed Competitor, hoping that this would be a step up. The verdict 6 months later: ....meh?They look and feel miles better than the starter set you'd pick up at the store. The bottom is significantly weightier, helping with stability on a surface and when you hold it in your hand. They don't cloud up, even in our old grandpa of a dishwasher. This set is probably intended for more everyday use (which is how we're using it), but it's a classy enough style that you'd feel comfortable serving up a fancy drink or two.That is, of course, if you have a full set remaining by the time your guests arrive. Over the last six months, we've lost a good three of the eight taller glasses due to chipping in the dishwasher and the occasional crack if you tap them against another glass accidentally stacking them in the cupboard. Turns out these are less durable than a toothpick. The shorter glasses have fared better than their older siblings; maybe it's an issue with the strength in the middle of the glass?This is disappointing, especially considering the reputation Libbey has for glassware. I know that it's glassware we're talking about here, not WWE fighters, so I know you have to be a little more careful with them. But alas, I was hoping to get a stronger set this time around. Long story short, if you're going to go with this set, expect to buy your replacement in a year or so. (Or sooner!)

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
overview_text: Decent starter cocktail set for newly of-age drinkers
comment: Nice, albeit cheaply made, cocktail glasses.This is a good set when you're ready to move away from the Solo cup to something a little more classy.  The color is very nice - I got the moss green - and the Art Deco pattern adds a touch of Gatsby elegance to a newly-forming barware collection.  The glasses are perfectly functional if not the highest quality.The issue I have with the quality, really, is two-fold:  First, these glasses are not dishwasher safe so they can only be washed by hand.  The glass is relatively thin and not suitable for high temperature cleaning.  Second, the production of the glass left a visible seam where the mold connected around a cylinder.  On higher quality glassware, the glass would be thicker and you would find no seam.  To the credit of these glasses, they did swab negative for lead when tested.While this is not a set I would add to my bar collection, I feel it's perfectly fine for someone just starting out who wants some nice-looking barware without spending hundreds of dollars.  It's cute, presentable, and would look great on a silver or gold bar tray for serving.

The "impressions" (dimples) are more shallow than the original.  Also, the glass feels a little different.  It seems more plastic-like, if that could even be a thing.  The glasses are more lightweight than the originals.  If I didn't have the originals, I probably would like these just fine.  Perhaps the manufacturer has had to cut corners to keep their price down.  I love ordering from Amazon, but sometimes wonder if there's a lot of price pressure on the manufacturers and we consumers end up on the short end. date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
comment: I didn't get these for my beer. I got them in the hopes that I could just keep them in the freezer, grab one, fill it with tap water, and they would be so cold they would bring the tap water down to the perfect temp without the nuisance of me adding ice cubes (don't have an ice cube maker).  And they do exactly that.  Water is just at the temperature I like.  I keep both glasses in the freeze, and can just switch them out whenever I want a cold glass of water.However, the silicone portion of the cup is unpleasantly cold to the touch, so I guess you can't have it both ways. For drinking beer, I would prefer my insulated glasses.Update: EXPERIMENT FAILED. I was keeping a half inch of water in the bottom of the glasses when I put them in the freezer to act as ice cubes  to chill my water faster.  The glass froze and break, destroying the product completely.  I guess these are only good for beer.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
overview_text: Good concept but much too hard to remove freezable holder from glasses for washing
comment: My title says it all. The idea is great, but removing the outer "coozie" with its freezer pack inserts from the glass is harder to do than I want to bother with. Instead, I am using a different type of freezable "coozie" with the glasses. They fit perfectly and the set up is much easier. If I could buy just the glasses, I would!

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
comment: I have a pair of these in the whiskey glass size and the beer glass size. I like the beer glasses better than the whiskey glasses because the orientation of the design is to be a sleeve not a drink chiller. This works well to keep already cold beer cold for longer. I frequently will have a beer as I am cooking or doing other things and it will take me an hour to finish a glass. This works well to keep a beer cold like that.The first time I poured a beer I noticed that it was cold enough that some of the foam actually froze. But any ice formed was thin and melted very quickly.There is also more to the chilled sleeve in the beer glass than the whiskey glass and that also matters in keeping things cold. Like the whiskey glass, the beer glass is just too thin. My beer glasses have not broken yet, but one of the Whiskey glasses broke (in the dishwasher) the third time I washed it.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
overview_text: Great idea, less so in the real world
comment: The idea behind these beer glasses is great, that is, sleeve a beer glass in a re-freezable ice pack and sleeve the ice packs in silicone so that you can grab the whole thing without freezing your hands.  Except it doesn't work out that well.  How they worked in reality.* My hands still froze.  The silicone sleeve did help but the glass was still very very cold to hold.* Frost developed on the silicone sleeve.  Yes, that's how cold the cup was.* Beer was icy cold.  A positive for a pilsner in the middle of summer but too cold for a brown ale in my opinion.* Tough to remove the silicone sleeve when the cups needed to go into the dishwasher.* Glass cups were thin and I would worry about breakage.After trying these cups as intended, I found that freezing the sleeves made the whole experience just too cold.  That said, I did think that simply chilling the sleeves in the fridge to be pretty nice.  That said, if you enjoy using beer mugs straight from the freezer then these might work for you to keep your beer icy longer.Note: These fit a standard 12oz beer only.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020
comment: They work well to keep beers cold by the pool and the thin drinking edge makes this better than most others, but don‚Äôt expect anything close to perfect finish. Much like other reviewers, I found one had a small but noticeable chip on the side and worse, where the color meets the stainless rim, one was obviously manufactured incorrectly with a pretty substantial blemish and uneven line. You can see it clearly in a pic I took which I‚Äôll attach if I can figure out how. Lucky for me at least both the chip and the manufacturing defect were on the same cup.So if you don‚Äôt care about looks and just want good function, these might be for you. If you do care about looks but only really need one glass, get the two-pack and maybe one of them will look like new if you‚Äôre lucky. Personally for $35 a set, I expect better quality control and am disappointed. Not upset enough to return them, but I am upset enough to write a review to warn others what to expect. Sorry I didn‚Äôt heed the advice of the other reviews I read mentioning this kind of thing happening, but knowing now that flaws really should be be expected, I sure wouldn‚Äôt buy another set. Too bad considering how awesome they are otherwise.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2019
overview_text: Performs admirably, but inconsistent quality means its not worth the premium.
comment: I had purchased the Snowfox martini glasses a while back and decided to pick up the beer tumblers.  My only issue with the martini glasses was the inconsistency of the paint - the pinstripe paint had bled into the base of the martini, creating overlaps in color.  However, this was a minor concern.Upon receipt of the beer tumblers, I noticed that one of them had this same issue with paint bleeding over. These particular tumblers also had large scratches and gouges that had removed the coating and the stainless steel can be seen beneath.These tumblers were shipped in a larger box that contained a second shipment of 4 x 20 oz standard beer glasses, which arrived pristine. The shipping box was whole with no dents or perforations, and the empty space was filled with the appropriate packing materials.  The tumblers themselves were coated in foam and plastic inside their original box. I can only assume that these were issues not observed by or did not concern QC at Snowfox and shipped anyway.From a day to day usage standpoint, I don't doubt that these tumblers would perform as well as the other Snowfox products I own - maintain cold temperatures for a significant time, no sweating, comfortable in the hand.  However, the price of the Snowfox products also includes the design of the product, which is a major selling point for me.  It's not worth paying a premium for a product  that lacks in consistency of quality.Based upon current reviews and my past experience, it seems that this not a unique situation, but uncommon.  So buyer beware.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
comment: I‚Äôve got two sets of vacuum insulated drinkware  from this brand. One set is a highball style with a white finish that is just beautiful, while the other is sort of a pint/beer style with a darker natural finish that was really scratched up right out of the box.As far as performance and use goes, I really like both sets.  For aesthetics and chance of getting something that looks damaged out of the box I recommend avoiding the finishes that display the metal grain.  The ones that I got just look awful.  There are lots (many dozens) of scratches and the finish is also slightly uneven. The white ones, on the other hand are perfect.  I can‚Äôt tell by sight whether they are enameled or painted, and who knows how long the finish will hold up, but out of the box they look great.Performance:Last night I pulled one out of the dishwasher and it was HOT.  I put some ice water in it to cool off and 5 minutes later, the outside of the cup was still as hot as it would‚Äôve been without ice water inside.  Pretty snazzy.

While I need more thermal cold drink glasses, I'm no longer looking favoring this product. Now preferring, with free shipping deal to my area, 3 separate colors (e.g., blue, red & clear) of quality food grade, non-breaking plastic around 6-6.5" tall (between 16 oz or so) stackable in the cupboard (and easily unstacked).

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2016
overview_text: Excellent look and feel but a bit on the fragile side
comment: I was provided the opportunity to review this product in return for  my honest opinion .Pros: Excellent design for hot or cold beverages  Unique and excellent look and feelCons: A bit on the fragile side, in fact I hand wash mine ( kind of a love/hate approach)Conclusion: If you are like a bull in a china shop these are not for you. However , if you treat these like fine china , I think you will be pleased.Final Note: Two of the glasses , in the box of 6 , was broken.  The outer packaging and the individual bubble wrap had no sign of abuse..IMHO, The thin inner box (see picture) inclines me to believe that this is a in-house,  shipping quality control issue.  .Follow up: I sent Ozeri Support the following suggestions:My Reviewer name is Rideo, the review I wrote on Amazon is listed below.I have worked in Transportation Logistics for a number of years including being the owner of a small trucking company.(Retired)My reviews are usually directed to the customer or end user.After, personal experience with one of your glass products, plus reviewing an assortment of customer complaints that are frustrating to both the customer and to Ozeri .... I would like for you to consider the following : A) IMHO ... Since there is very seldom "outer" damage upon customer receipt ,leads me to believe, the root of the problem is the flimsy originating box. B) Investing in a multi-wall or multi-cardboard ply for both the box itself plus between the 6 compartments (still using bubble wrap around each glass ) in conjunction with your present Amazon method of shipment, should drastically reduce and/or hopefully eliminate the current damage rate. C) After this,Prior to shipping , for quality control feedback, I would test drop a few boxes now and then at random ( from 2 to 3 ft.) D) Also, keep in mind, a elegant contoured glass (yes,even double wall) tend to ,by nature of it's unique design (Contact Points), be prone to damage, more so than standard drinking glasses. D) Final note, Also I would suggest that the glasses be separated in the dishwasher (or hand washed) as a further precaution . E) These glasses , with the right precautions , can be a great investment. F) The more I make use of mine, the more I like them... they are now my multi-purpose , go to glass of choice ! Kindest Regards, Rideo

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2016

comment: I received these glasses as a promotion in exchange for an honest review. Let's be honest. Glasses hold liquid and these do the job. I haven't used them for hot beverages yet but they do a great job of keeping cold drinks and ice intact. The shape is great for little fingers to grasp and the clear double walls have a floating effect that is admittedly pretty cool. Unfortunately we had one that cracked and let liquid into the interior cavity of the wall so they have not been very durable over all.  Thank you to Ozeri for the chance to sample these glasses.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2014
comment: It's a good news-bad news thing with these glasses: They are beautiful, rather large for double-wall glasses, and have a terrific 'feel' to them; yet, when they arrived, two of the six glasses were broken.  (Amazon made a 'price adjustment' in the form of an Amazon credit -- which is nice -- but it still took half an hour and left me with four rather than six glasses).My surmise is that the problem was the seller's only insofar as the seller, for some reason, chooses to ship its product by FedEx, which is notoriously hard on packages in my experience; I can't believe this would have happened with UPS -- which has successfully shipped me several Bodum and Epare double-wall glasses, all products arriving in perfect condition.Here's hoping this seller gets the message and selects a better carrier.  Thanks again to Amazon for making things OK -- tho I'd much rather everything worked out as it should have.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2014
overview_text: Love them but not as durable as manufacturer claims.
comment: I really love the idea of these. I have a collection of thermal insulated tumblers. But, I do prefer a glass. I ordered 3 sets. One for myself. One for a girlfriend I knew would just love them and one for my mom. My friend and I have both had one break from putting ice in them from the ice maker. So, I hardly think they are durable glass! I now handle them as if they are very fragile and hand put in my ice and hand wash them. I still like them but they are not as durable as the manufacture implies. date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2014
overview_text: Great...until they BREAK!... but good customer service from Ozeri
comment: I had been searching for a product just like this: a beautiful glass that would not perspire on your hands and furniture, help keep your cold drinks cold and hot drinks hot. It does just that, and is visually attractive as well. The curve in the surface creates a nice grip for your hand. The glasses are very nice looking and actually work quite well for insulation, keeping condensation off your tabletops.BUT...both of ours are broken in less than a year.The first one cracked AS it was being washed, carefully BY HAND in a dish-pan with warm water. It literally cracked with no pressure or contact with another dish, in my hands as I was washing it. We threw it out.The other one fell off a table onto our floor (about two feet onto vinyl linoleum). As an accident, I cannot fault it for breaking, but I do fault it for literally SHATTERING into dozens and dozens of pieces. My wife and I spent quite a long time picking up many tiny fragments of glass. We then vacuumed very thoroughly. We used high-intensity flashlights to look for pieces and then picked up more. The next day will still found even more tiny shattered slices and splinters of glass.That is the reason I am giving this product one star (even though it does function well and looks nice): the company clearly CLAIMS that the glass used is very tough. You have probably already read the product descriptions:"Heat and shatter resistant borosilicate glasses" , "Stronger and more durable than common glass", "Completely dishwasher, microwave and freezer safe", "Made of durable, heat resistant, mouth-blown borosilicate glass of the finest quality", "handmade glasses designed for lifetime use."Upon one cracking in my hand and the other shattering upon impact, I can without question tell you that the material used in the glasses I received is the most DELICATE and THIN glass that I have ever seen. I am also posting photographs in the product page of the shattered glass as well as a side-view of the thin-ness of a piece of the glass (piece held in my fingers shot with a macro lens). Please do have a look before you judge my review.Also, just of a note: I have seen claims made that Ozeri is a small American company. The box the glasses are packaged in clearly states the product is "made in China."I loved these glasses until they both broke, bragged about them to my wife and others. But, they are clearly not very durable. And for the price and the short life-span are very expensive (they cost $10 a piece). I had actually planned on giving them five stars and saying how wonderful they work and how beautiful they are. I wish I could find something similar to replace them, but I cannot. However, I will not buy another set as I would never be able to trust them. I am planning on contacting the company to see how they will honor the warranty (stated one year), and will report my situation later in this review.I hope my experience has been of some help, I am truly saddened that I am writing a bad review for this otherwise great product.***UPDATE  3/3/2014***After contacting Ozeri, they replied to my email within hours. They were friendly and helpful, and after getting my purchase info, sent out replacement glasses to me at no charge. The new set arrived in perfect condition. I must say that i am still very wary of the durability factor of the glass, but they are beautiful and functional glasses, and the customer service from Ozeri is very comforting. I have updated my rating from 1 to 3 stars because of that.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2014
overview_text: Ozeri Serafino Double Wall insulated Beverage 12oz
comment: My daughter bought 4 of these glasses for me at Christmas and I was delighted.  Living in Florida with the heat, my normal glasses would leave a lot of condensation.  I moved on to Tervis Tumblers but I would prefer glass. First she bought the smaller glasses and I thought they were great. They are not forgiving with granite countertops and one of them chipped the glass on the rim. I took the blame on that one and vowed to be a bit more careful in the future.  Now, the first time I used the large glass,I put some ice cubes in the glass and water.  The ice cubes stuck together in the middle of the glass and after a took a sip and the liquid moved down, so did the ice cubes. They immediately popped and hit the bottom breaking the glass completely. It did not injure me but was so close.The glasses are a wonderful idea, I just don't know weather they are strong enough.Judie Johnson, The Villages, FL

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2013
comment: Update. Basically every one of the glasses we bought eventually broke. date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2013
comment: These are excellent glasses. However, one of them cracked easily when hit by a spoon (on the lip of the glass).  If not for that, i would give a 5-star rating

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2013
comment: I am forever in search of a really hot cup of coffee from a coffee maker, so when I saw these I wanted to try them out.  They arrived safely packed and worked as advertised, especially when pre-filled with hot water before adding coffee.  The dent in the middle is aesthetically pleasing and makes the glass easy to hold. My only small complaints were that the lip seems too small to prevent a small dribble from forming where your mouth meets the glass, and the height of the glasses makes it too tall to fit under my one-cup coffeemaker at the mug height, and too short to fit at the thermal car-cup height, so the coffee spit a bit on the way down from the funnel to the glass.However, in two weeks two of the thermal glasses have broken.  Now, I live in a tough house for glassware -- two cats, a big dog with a big tail, a granite counter -- but still, I have glasses, including crystal stemware, that somehow lasts for years. Not these -- one broke one week on when a cat knocked it over.  It didn't even hit the floor, just the chair seat, but the thin outer wall broke.  The second one perished a week later -- somehow it developed a crack around the top in the dishwasher that let water between the two walls. I don't have much hope for the other two lasting much longer.Go ahead and buy these if you want a hot beverage in a nice-looking (if slightly drippy) container, but be prepared to treat them like fragile crystal rather than sturdy everyday glassware.

date_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2012
overview_text: Disclosure: Serafino Glasses Made in China
comment: Just got these...Do not know if they are good or bad yet.Just want to point out one thing!Doesn't Serafino seem like an Italian name to you?There is much discussion in associated literature about the high quality of glass and the hand-blown unique features of each glass.I have to say that I expected that these relatively expensive treasures would be made in some other place than China.It would have been nice if it was Italy, USA, France, Greece, Spain, etc.But, no, I was wrong; they are made in China!What is irritating to us is that the word "China" (...and there is only one.)is carefully concealed under the underside glued flaps of the bottom of the box in which they are packaged. If I had not flattened the box to put in our shredder (we use these shreds in our garden)I would have never known the origin of his product...I doubt that this would have been the case if the origin had been one of the above mentioned countries.Thanks for reading.

overview_text: It‚Äôs smaller and doesn‚Äôt have a lid. Not what I thought I was ordering.
comment: I‚Äôm returning mine because I thought I was purchasing the same mug like I currently have. I have the Stanley Classic Stay Chill Vacuum Insulated Pint Glass, 16oz that I bought elsewhere and it is very high quality and has a nice lid with a big opening which allows my coffee to cool just enough to not burn my mouth. I thought this was the same thing but it is smaller and less impressive. (See picture of Stanley on right) It also doesn‚Äôt have a lid. I can see that some people might like this because it is smaller and fits in your hand nicely. I measured 2 cups of water into it and it fills just below the rim. My preferred mug (pictured on the left in picture) holds 2 measured cups and still has over an inch of room to the top. Mine is also thicker and more substantial feeling. Both are 16 ounces and you can see how much smaller this Stanley stacking pint is. Some people might like that, especially for cold drinks, but mine is going back.
